page.title: 02Geology and Landscape
page.content: The area is composed of Boulder Clay overlying Oxford Clay with Oolitic limestone and Cornbrash exposed east of the village of Stagsden,and Oxford Clay exposed along the valley bottom.The land rises from 118 feet to 300 feet around Pictshill Gorse. In the area generally intensive farming has resulted in the loss of hedgerows,removal of trees and woodland during field enlargement,plus losses due to elm disease have made the area bleak.However in this area there is still some tree cover notably Hanger Wood and village trees in Stagsden and around the Bird Gardens.The local council consider the trees along the road between Stagsden and the a 428 so vital that they are protected by Tree Preservation Orders.
